briefTitle: Effects of Bevespi on Ventilation and Gas Exchange Abnormalities in COPD Assessed by 129Xe MRI

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Clinical diagnosis of COPD confirmed by post-bronchodilator spirometry demonstrating (forced expiratory volume at 1 second(FEV1)/forced vital capacity (FVC) \< 0.70 and forced expiratory volume at 1 second (FEV1) in GOLD 2 or 3 stage (30%â‰¤ (forced expiratory volume at 1 second \[FEV1\] \< 80%)
* Willing and able to give informed consent and adhere to visit/protocol schedules
* Women of childbearing potential must have a negative urine pregnancy test

Exclusion Criteria:

* Upper respiratory tract infection within 6 weeks
* Chronic systemic corticosteroid use \> 10 mg/day of prednisone

  * Chronic oxygen use (intermittent or continuous)
  * Previous lung resection surgery or decortication
  * Previous history of pneumothorax
  * Evidence of interstitial, occupational or chronic infectious lung disease by imaging studies
  * History of exposure to occupational or environmental hazards that are known to cause lung diseases
  * For women of child bearing potential, positive pregnancy test
  * Major chronic illnesses which in the judgement of the study physician would interfere with participation in the study
  * Patients who are not willing to withhold COPD inhalers for the run-in period.

    * MRI is contraindicated based on responses to MRI screening questionnaire
    * Subject is pregnant or lactating
    * Respiratory illness of a bacterial or viral etiology within 30 days of MRI
    * Subject has any form of known cardiac arrhythmia
    * Subject does not fit into 129Xe vest coil used for MRI
    * Subject cannot hold his/her breath for 15 seconds
    * Subject deemed unlikely to be able to comply with instructions during imaging

outcomeMeasures.title: Ventilation Distribution as Measured by Ventilation Defect+Low Percent
outcomeMeasures.description: The ventilation distribution as measured by ventilation defect+low percent is to measure the area of the lung that has no air.

outcomeMeasures.title: Barrier Uptake.
outcomeMeasures.description: Diffusion of Xe gas across the lung membrane into the blood. This measures how well oxygen goes through the lung into the blood.

outcomeMeasures.title: Red Blood Cell (RBC) Uptake
outcomeMeasures.description: Amount of Xe gas that enters the blood stream after it diffuses across the lung membrane

outcomeMeasures.title: Pulmonary Function Test - Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
outcomeMeasures.description: Forced vital capacity (FVC) is the amount of air that can be forcibly exhaled from the lungs after taking the deepest breath possible, as measured by spirometry.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pulmonary Function Test - Forced Expiratory Volume-one Second (FEV1)
outcomeMeasures.description: FEV1 is a lung airflow measure to assess the amount of air that can be blown out in one second.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pulmonary Function Test - Total Lung Capacity (TLC)
outcomeMeasures.description: Total Lung Capacity (TLC) is the volume in the lungs at a maximal inhalation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pulmonary Function Test - Residual Volume (RV)
outcomeMeasures.description: Residual volume (RV) is the volume of air remaining in the lungs after a maximal exhalation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pulmonary Function Test - Diffusing Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide (DLCO)
outcomeMeasures.description: DLCO measures the ability of oxygen to travel from the air sacs of the lungs to the blood stream.

outcomeMeasures.title: 6-minute Walk Test (6MWT)
outcomeMeasures.description: The 6-minute walk test (6MWT) measures the distance walked at a natural pace for 6 minutes.

outcomeMeasures.title: St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Score
outcomeMeasures.description: The SGRQ is used to measure impact on overall health, daily life, and perceived well-being in patients with obstructive airways disease. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating more limitations.

outcomeMeasures.title: Rating of Perceived Dyspnea (RPD) Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: A patient reported outcome to measure perceived exertion during physical activity. The RPD scale goes from 0 to 10, where 0 = no shortness of breath at all and 10 = maximal shortness of breath (needing to stop the exercise or activity).

outcomeMeasures.title: COPD Assessment Test (CAT) Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Functional measurement for COPD patients. Range of CAT scores from 0-40. Higher scores denote a more severe impact of COPD on a patient's life.
